sentences.english: The newspapers once again filled their columns with salacious details.
sentences.chinese: 赤裸裸的猥褻細節再度充斥了報紙的版面。

sentences.english: I guess I like poverty porn.
sentences.chinese: 我猜我喜歡看這種赤裸裸的貧困。

sentences.english: All it comes down to is Gazprom's naked ambition.
sentences.chinese: 所有歸結到一點，就是聖彼得堡赤裸裸的野心。

sentences.english: Despite its name, the People's Alliance is explicitly antidemocratic.
sentences.chinese: 現如今，除了名字外，人民聯盟是赤裸裸反民主的。

sentences.english: I have come to this world trark naked, and in the twinkling of an eye, I am to go back as stark naked as ever.
sentences.chinese: 我赤裸裸來到這世界，轉眼間也將赤裸裸的回去罷？

sentences.english: I have come to this world trark naked, and in the twinkling of an eye, I am to go back as stark naked as ever.
sentences.chinese: 我赤裸裸來到這世界，轉眼間也將赤裸裸的回去罷？

sentences.english: On the streets of Moscow, the development of the market economy played out in raw fashion.
sentences.chinese: 在莫斯科街道上，市場經濟的發展赤裸裸地展現出來。
看哪，這赤裸裸的自戀之沙。

sentences.english: To have such "naked" yet unexposed officials makes for a second failing.
sentences.chinese: 出現如此“赤裸裸”卻未被曝光的官員是第二點失誤。

sentences.english: Naked came I into this world, and naked must I go out. ----Cervantes.
sentences.chinese: 我赤裸裸地來到這個世界，也要赤裸裸的離去。

sentences.english: Naked came I into this world, and naked must I go out. ----Cervantes.
sentences.chinese: 我赤裸裸地來到這個世界，也要赤裸裸的離去。

sentences.english: Unless it’s a warm day, I’m only naked inside.
sentences.chinese: 除非風和日麗，要不然我只是赤裸裸地呆在屋裏。

sentences.english: Walk down the street remembering that people are nude under their clothes.
sentences.chinese: 接着往下，記住，每個人的衣服下面同樣都是赤裸裸。

sentences.english: Whatever you spell over me, but I will hug the entire world nakedly.
sentences.chinese: 任由你們讀懂我，而我會赤裸裸地擁抱整個世界。

definition: to have no sense of shame
(of a person) honorable/not devious/(of a behavior) fair and aboveboard/without tricks/openly/(of a situation) out in the open
overt/to make no secret (of one's presence)/grandiose/with great scope
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful
